title: Stop Harassing People for not taking Flash
body: Im sick and tired of it. I tend to get harassed every game I don't take flash because its a personal preference of mine. I don't care what other people think flash is, I just don't prefer using it, so stop flaming people for what they prefer to use.

To all of you who disagree, here is my personal reason why I decide not to take flash:

Pros:
Can blink over walls/veigar stun
Allows you to get closer to opponents or allies
Is significant in tricking opponents where you went
Allows you to secure kills

Cons:
Has a 300 second cooldown (240 with Distortion (Which no one ever really takes))
Chance of not jumping far enough
Mobile champs catch up easily anyways
Common mistake of flashing a inch before dying trying to activate other spells.

To me, although the Pros usually outweigh the cons, I just don't prefer flash mostly due to the 5 minute cooldown on it. I believe that taking something like Exhaust, heal, barrier, or ignite is much more useful due to the lower cooldown and being able to take in and dish out more damage.

Many champs can hop over walls without Flash, but at least you go from 5v1 to 1v1, giving you a chance to turn it around, or make it to your team before you die.

"But flash is objectively better"

Add more argument to it... flash move you by 1 extra second of movement ever 300 seconds. Objectively, that's 0.3% increase in speed.

By comparison, clarity makes you AND your teammate recover for 66% of their mana in the same amount of time. This mean that anyone who can make more then 0.25% of their damage from mana skills would benefit more from clarity then from flash. It seem reasonnable to me to assume that ziggs would deal more then 1% of damage from his skills.

The only thing with flash is that it's flashy. If people using clarity were as much excited to make a kill with less then 66% of their mana left as someone who use a flash to escape death. They would rage at you for taking that little jumpy flash instead of the awesome long jump teleport.

And that assuming that people use their flash to escape death somewhat reliably. More often then not, I see people using their flash where a single potion could fix the damage they would have received anyway...

Those % you give mean nothing. 

Clarity won't save your ass when you ganked. 

Only Flash can save you if you get caught out of position. Barrier and Heal will just delay your death by maybe 1-2 second, then you are still dead. If used well, Flash is essentially a free buyback every 5 minutes. That alone is already game-breaking. 

But Flash can do even more: a single Flash initiation on an unsuspecting carry (especially if they don't have Flash available for themselves) can completely turn the tides of a game. 

In a lot of cases, LoL is no longer just about numbers. You can have 1000 AD, if you never get to attack, it doesn't matter. 

Flash is so good because it is both the best offensive and the best defensive spell (while Ignite is 100% offensive for example). When a single kill or death can determine who wins or loses, nothing is more valuable than a free, reliable, versatile, blink.

You shouldn't just blindly take Flash because everyone takes Flash, but instead you should take it when it is going to give you more advantage than another summoner spell in its place.

By not having Flash, you lose a free gap-closer / escape, which can help chase enemies or escape from ganks.  How useful is that to you?  If another summoner spell is more useful, then take that instead.

In direct combat, other summoner spells (Exhaust, Ignite, Barrier, Heal) are generally more powerful than Flash, so by taking Flash you are giving up duelling power for the ability to escape ganks or to make flashy plays.
Again, the choice should depend on what you want to do in the game.

Just remember that if you don't take Flash or Ghost as a solo laner, the enemy jungler is going to see that and try to camp you.  You need to be prepared for that, and should really only do it if you know you can survive that extra jungler attention.

Some examples of who can easily get away without taking Flash:

 - Extremely tanky champions can often be better served with Ghost (it covers more distance overall, but leaves them in attack range for longer - a tank usually won't die instantly, so the extra distance helps them.)
 - Mobile champions can afford to take another spell in some cases, depending on the circumstances - but just because they can doesn't mean that Flash isn't often still the better choice.  For example, a Katarina can get away with Teleport/Ignite quite easily, but Flash is far more useful for her to get kills (and she needs kills to snowball) since it allows her a long-ranged Flash-Shunpo engage.
 - Junglers can pretty much take whatever they want, since they are the ones who are least likely to need to Flash away from a gank.  Again, pick whatever is the most effective.

The fact of the matter is, there is barely even a handful of champions in the game that are viable without flash. Examples being, Shaco, Hecarim, Renekton, and Shyvana. I can't really think of any other champions, so if you think of one, let me know.

Because flash is necessary for almost every champion to be viable as it is by far the most overpowered summoner spell with a near infinite amount of possible utility, you really need it if you want to perform well.
